artifacts.description: Verify role-based and scope-based access controls work correctly (AC-3)

evidence.description: Admin should have admin role, user should not
Admin should have write scope, user should not
Multi-role checks should work correctly

artifacts.description: Verify CORS is not permissive by default (AC-4)

evidence.description: Default CORS should not be permissive
Permissive CORS should be detected

artifacts.description: Verify account locks after configured number of failed login attempts (AC-7)

evidence.description: First two attempts should not lock out
Third attempt should trigger lockout

artifacts.description: Verify session policy includes idle and absolute timeout (AC-11)

evidence.description: Idle timeout should be configured
Max lifetime should be configured
Fresh session should not be terminated

artifacts.description: Verify sessions terminate after max lifetime is exceeded (AC-12)

evidence.description: Fresh session should not be terminated
Max lifetime should be configured

details.idle_timeout_msg: Your session timed out due to inactivity. Please sign in again.
details.max_lifetime_msg: Your session has expired. Please sign in again.
details.token_expired_msg: Your session has expired. Please sign in again.

evidence.description: Termination reasons should have messages

artifacts.description: Verify all required security event types are defined (AU-2)

evidence.description: Authentication events should be defined
Access control events should be defined
System events should be defined

artifacts.description: Verify security events have required audit fields (AU-3)

evidence.description: Event should have a name
Event should have a category
Event should have a severity

artifacts.description: Verify all security events have UTC timestamps (AU-8)

evidence.description: Security events should exist for timestamping
Tracing should provide UTC timestamps

evidence.content: AU-8: Timestamps are automatically added by tracing crate in UTC

artifacts.description: Verify audit logs are signed and tamper-evident (AU-9)

evidence.description: Algorithm should be NIST-approved HMAC-SHA256
All audit records should be HMAC signed
Audit chain integrity should be verifiable
Records should be cryptographically chained
Tampered records should be detected

artifacts.description: Verify audit records can be generated with required fields (AU-12)

evidence.description: Audit record should have all required fields
All audit outcomes should be defined

artifacts.description: Verify session lifecycle events are logged for audit (AU-14)

evidence.description: Session state should have audit-relevant fields
Termination reasons should be defined for audit logging
Session termination should be auditable

artifacts.description: Verify correlation ID generation and extraction (AU-16)

evidence.description: Audit middleware should handle correlation IDs
Should extract correlation ID from X-Request-ID header
Should support X-Correlation-ID header

artifacts.description: Verify security headers are enabled by default (CM-6)

evidence.description: Security headers should be enabled by default
Tracing should be enabled by default

artifacts.description: Verify MFA policy correctly enforces multi-factor authentication (IA-2)

evidence.description: MFA should be enforced for claims without AMR
MFA should be satisfied with proper AMR claims

artifacts.description: Verify mTLS enforcement for service-to-service authentication (IA-3)

evidence.description: All mTLS modes should be defined
Client certificate detection should work via headers
Missing client certificate should be detected
Required mode should be FedRAMP High compliant
Optional and Disabled modes should not be FedRAMP High compliant

artifacts.description: Verify secure authenticator handling with constant-time comparison (IA-5)

evidence.description: Constant-time comparison should match equal values
Constant-time comparison should reject unequal values
String constant-time comparison should work correctly
Should handle unequal length inputs safely

artifacts.description: Verify password policy meets NIST 800-63B requirements (IA-5(1))

evidence.description: Weak/common password should be rejected
Short password should be rejected
Strong password should be accepted

artifacts.description: Verify secret detection identifies embedded authenticators (IA-5(7))

evidence.description: Should detect AWS access keys
Should detect GitHub tokens
Should detect private keys
Clean code should produce no findings

evidence.content: Secret categories covered: ["AWS Credentials", "API Key", "Git Token", "Private Key", "OAuth/JWT Token", "Database Credential"]

artifacts.description: Verify authentication errors don't leak sensitive information (IA-6)

evidence.description: Auth errors should not reveal if user exists
Internal errors should be generic in production
Different auth failures should produce same external message

artifacts.description: Verify rate limiting is enabled and configured correctly (SC-5)

evidence.description: Rate limiting should be enabled by default
Request timeout should be configured
Max request size should be configured

artifacts.description: Verify transmission security for HTTP headers and database connections (SC-8)

evidence.description: Security headers should be enabled by default
Security headers can be disabled when needed

artifacts.description: Verify network sessions can be disconnected per policy (SC-10)

evidence.description: Idle timeout should be configured for disconnection

reasons.message: Your session timed out due to inactivity. Please sign in again.
Your session has expired. Please sign in again.
Your session can no longer be extended. Please sign in again.
Your session has expired. Please sign in again.

evidence.description: Termination reasons should have descriptive messages

artifacts.description: Verify key rotation policies and lifecycle management (SC-12)

evidence.description: Freshly registered key should not need rotation
Active key should support encrypt and decrypt
Key states should have correct capabilities

artifacts.description: Verify constant-time comparison prevents timing attacks (SC-13)

evidence.description: Equal values should match
Different values should not match
Different length values should not match

artifacts.description: Verify FIPS 140-3 validated cryptography is available (SC-13)

evidence.description: FIPS mode should be detectable
Encryption should work correctly

artifacts.description: Verify session state authenticity and anti-tampering (SC-23)

evidence.description: Sessions should have unique identifiers
Session should track creation time
Session should track last activity for idle timeout
Session should be invalidatable for security
Session policy should enforce timeout checks

artifacts.description: Verify field-level encryption protects data at rest (SC-28)

evidence.description: AES-256-GCM algorithm properties are correct
Field encryptor can be initialized with valid key
Encryption roundtrip preserves data
EncryptedField wrapper works correctly
Tampered ciphertext is detected and rejected
Each encryption uses unique nonce (no ciphertext reuse)

artifacts.description: Verify input validation rejects malformed data and sanitizes XSS (SI-10)

evidence.description: Valid email should be accepted

details.result: Err(ValidationError { field: Some("email"), code: InvalidEmail, message: "Invalid email format" })

evidence.description: Invalid email should be rejected
XSS payload should be sanitized
Length validation should work

artifacts.description: Verify errors do not leak sensitive info in production (SI-11)

evidence.description: Production config should hide error details
Development config should show error details
Internal errors should not expose details
